intro: Arnocrinum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth arnica, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woods and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Arnocrinum glabrum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has mild medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
